TableField.name: IncidentReportID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to track situations and incidents

TableField.name: OrganizationID
TableField.phrase: Organization|The primary organization involved in the incident

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The primary organization involved in the incident

RemoteField.name: PersonAccountableID
RemoteField.phrase: Person Accountable|The individual assigned primary accountability for managing the report process

ForeignField.name: PersonAccountable
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The individual assigned primary accountability for managing the report process

TableField.name: MannerReceivedID
TableField.phrase: Manner Received|The manner in which the initial report was received

CodeField.name: MannerReceived
CodeField.phrase: Manner Received|The manner in which the initial report was received

RemoteField.name: EventDate
RemoteField.phrase: Event Date|Date the situation or incident occurred

RecordMetaField.name: EntryDate
RecordMetaField.phrase: System Entry Date|Date the situation or incident was entered into the system

CalculatedField.name: EntryDelay
CalculatedField.phrase: System Entry Delay|A calculated field based on the number of days between the incident data entry date and the event date

RemoteField.name: SubmittedByID
RemoteField.phrase: Submitted By|The name of the individual that submitted this report into the system

ForeignField.name: SubmittedBy
ForeignField.phrase: Submitted By|The name of the individual that submitted this report into the system

ForeignField.name: SubmittedByEmail
ForeignField.phrase: Submitted By Email|The email address of the individual that submitted this report into the system

RemoteField.name: ReportDate
RemoteField.phrase: Report Date|Date the situation or incident was first reported

CalculatedField.name: ReportDelay
CalculatedField.phrase: Report Delay|A calculated field based on the number of days between the incident date and the incident report date

TableField.name: ReportSourceID
TableField.phrase: Report Source|The source of the report. Whether the report was generated anonymously, by a known person, or by an unknown source

CodeField.name: ReportSource
CodeField.phrase: Report Source|The source of the report. Whether the report was generated anonymously, by a known person, or by an unknown source

RemoteField.name: PersonReportingID
RemoteField.phrase: Person Reporting|The name of the individual that reported the situation or incident

ForeignField.name: PersonReporting
ForeignField.phrase: Person Reporting|The name of the individual that reported the situation or incident

TableField.name: RepPersonTypeID
TableField.phrase: Reporting Person Type|The organizational affiliation of the person reporting

CodeField.name: RepPersonType
CodeField.phrase: Reporting Person Type|The organizational affiliation of the person reporting

TableField.name: OnCoPropID
TableField.phrase: On Company Property|Whether this situation or incident occurred on company property

CodeField.name: OnCoProp
CodeField.phrase: On Company Property|Whether this situation or incident occurred on company property

TableField.name: RepEvent
TableField.phrase: Reported Event|A detailed description of the situation or incident, as received from the reporter. Every effort should be made to enter the reporter's comments on a word-for-word basis. Who, What, When, Where and Why
TableField.sample: Mattias Thorslund, an employee, was witnessed eating lunch on the process line during lunch on Friday, October 31, 2003.

TableField.name: SubObserv
TableField.phrase: Submission Observations|A detailed description of any observations or impressions about the reporter or other information about the event that might be helpful in assessing the situation or incident
TableField.sample: The reporting person seemed to be bitter towards Mr. Thorslund. The reporting person stated that Mr. Thorslund had bothered him on prior occassions

TableField.name: IncidentName
TableField.phrase: Incident Name|A unique name used to identify the situation or incident

TableField.name: CodeName
TableField.phrase: Code Name|A unique code name used to reference situation or incident information without disclosing the particular situation or incident

TableField.name: PotVioLaw
TableField.phrase: Potential Violation of Law|Check this box if this situation or incident is a potential violation of law

TableField.name: GovtRept
TableField.phrase: Governmental Reporting Requirements|Check this box if this situation or incident requires governmental reporting

SummaryField.name: ClaimCosts
SummaryField.phrase: Claim Costs|The total estimated amount of the cost to manage and mitigate claims related to this incident

SummaryField.name: RollupCosts
SummaryField.phrase: Rollup Costs|The total estimated amount of the cost to manage and mitigate claims related to this incident

SummaryField.name: LocalCosts
SummaryField.phrase: Local Costs|The estimated amount of costs attached directly to this record

CalculatedField.name: TotalCost
CalculatedField.phrase: Total Cost|The automatically calculated cost associated with this incident. Costs are derived by compiling all claim costs and those costs associated with managing this incident and tracked within the Costs module

RangeField.name: CostSeverityID
RangeField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

ForeignField.name: CostSeverityValue
ForeignField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

ForeignField.name: CostSeverity
ForeignField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

RemoteField.name: CachedTotalCost
RemoteField.phrase: Total Cost|The total cost of this incident

CalculatedField.name: CalculatedSeverityValue
CalculatedField.phrase: Calculated Severity Value|The greater of the User-assigned severity value and the acutomaticlly assigned Cost Severity value

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodID
RemoteField.phrase: Risk Likelihood|A description of the risk likelihood based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Likelihoods module

ForeignField.name: LikelihoodValue
ForeignField.phrase: Likelihood Value|A numerical value assigned to the likelihood of risk occurrence. The likelihood value is used in combination with the severity value to calculate a risk index score and an associated recommendation to mitigate the risk

ForeignField.name: RiskLikelihoodTerm
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Likelihood Term|A one word description of the risk likelihood level

ForeignField.name: Likelihood
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Likelihood|A description of the risk likelihood based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Likelihoods module

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodStatusID
RemoteField.phrase: Likelihood Status|The present status of efforts to resolve the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat

CodeField.name: LikelihoodStatus
CodeField.phrase: Likelihood Status|The present status of efforts to resolve the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodFactors
RemoteField.phrase: Likelihood Factors|A detailed description of the factors affecting the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat
RemoteField.sample: SCBAs were purchased for all First Responders and all responders have been trained by the Fire Department

RemoteField.name: SeverityID
RemoteField.phrase: Risk Severity|A description of the risk severity based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Severities module

ForeignField.name: SeverityValue
ForeignField.phrase: Severity Value|A numerical value assigned to the severity of risk or loss. The severity value is used in combination with the likelihood value to calculate a risk index score and an associated recommendation to mitigate the risk of loss

ForeignField.name: RiskSeverityTerm
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Severity Term|A one word description of the risk severity level

ForeignField.name: Severity
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Severity|A description of the risk severity based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Severities module
ForeignField.sample: SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00

CalculatedField.name: IndexValue
CalculatedField.phrase: Index Value|A calculated field based on the risk likelihood and risk severity. The resulting risk index value is compared against the assigned risk index recommendations entered into the Risk Index module and the respective recommendation is displayed

RangeField.name: RiskRecommendation
RangeField.phrase: Recommended Action|An automatically assigned recommendation, based on the values assigned for Likelihood and Severity
RangeField.sample: Take action if and when appropriate

TableField.name: InvRptDftComp
TableField.phrase: Investigative Draft Report Completed|Check this box if an investigative draft report has been completed

TableField.name: InvRptDftCompDate
TableField.phrase: Completion Date|Date the investigative draft report was completed

RemoteField.name: InvRptDftCompByID
RemoteField.phrase: Draft Report Author|The name of the individual that authored the investigative draft report

ForeignField.name: InvRptDftCompBy
ForeignField.phrase: Draft Report Author|The name of the individual that authored the investigative draft report

TableField.name: InvRptDftSent
TableField.phrase: Investigative Draft Report Sent|Check this box if an investigative draft report has been sent

TableField.name: InvRptDftSentDate
TableField.phrase: Draft Report Sent Date|Date the investigative draft report was sent

CalculatedField.name: InvRptDftSentDelay
CalculatedField.phrase: Draft Report Delay|A calculated field based on the number of days between the event date and the draft investigation report sent date

RemoteField.name: InvRptDftSentByID
RemoteField.phrase: Draft Report Sender|The name of the individual that sent the investigative draft report

ForeignField.name: InvRptDftSentBy
ForeignField.phrase: Sender|The name of the individual that sent the investigative draft report

TableField.name: InvRptDftReceived
TableField.phrase: Investigative Draft Report Received|Check this box if an investigative draft report has been received

TableField.name: InvRptDftRecDate
TableField.phrase: Received Date|Date the investigative draft report was received

RemoteField.name: InvRptDftRecByID
RemoteField.phrase: Draft Report Recipient|The name of the individual that received the investigative draft report

ForeignField.name: InvRptDftRecBy
ForeignField.phrase: Recipient|The name of the individual that received the investigative draft report

TableField.name: InvRptFinalized
TableField.phrase: Investigative Report Finalized|Check this box if an investigative report has been finalized

TableField.name: InvRptFinalDate
TableField.phrase: Final Report Date|Date the investigative report was finalized

CalculatedField.name: InvRptFinalDelay
CalculatedField.phrase: Final Report Delay|A calculated field based on the number of days between the event date and the final investigation report completion date

RemoteField.name: InvRptFinalByID
RemoteField.phrase: Final Report Author|The name of the individual that authored the final investigative report

ForeignField.name: InvRptFinalBy
ForeignField.phrase: Final Report Author|The name of the individual that authored the final investigative report

TableField.name: IncidentStatusID
TableField.phrase: Incident Status|Status of the situation or incident report and associated investigation

CodeField.name: IncidentStatus
CodeField.phrase: Incident Status|Status of the situation or incident report and associated investigation

TableField.name: KeyLearning
TableField.phrase: Key Learning|A detailed description of the key learnings from the reported situation or incident. All suggested changes to Policies, Guidelines, Training Materials and other business processes should be included
TableField.sample: All employees should receive training regarding the definition of workers' compensation fraud and the penalties associated with conviction

RemoteField.name: ClosureDate
RemoteField.phrase: Incident Closure Date|The date the situation or incident report was closed

CalculatedField.name: ClosureDelay
CalculatedField.phrase: Incident Closure Delay|A calculated field based on the number of days between the event date and the incident report closure date

SummaryField.name: Situations
SummaryField.phrase: Situation type|A list of situation types resulting in an incident report
SummaryField.sample: Information Technology | Malicious Code Attack: Script (logging)

SummaryField.name: RiskImperatives
SummaryField.phrase: Risk Imperatives|A list of associated Risk Imperatives

CombinedField.name: ReportDelayCalc
CombinedField.phrase: Report Delay|A calculated field based on the number of hours between the incident date and the incident report date

CombinedField.name: EntryDelayCalc
CombinedField.phrase: System Entry Delay|A calculated field based on the number of hours between the incident data entry date and the event date

CombinedField.name: InvRptDftSentDelayCalc
CombinedField.phrase: Draft Report Delay|A calculated field based on the number of hours between the event date and the draft investigation report sent date

CombinedField.name: InvRptFinalDelayCalc
CombinedField.phrase: Final Report Delay|A calculated field based on the number of hours between the event date and the final investigation report completion date

CombinedField.name: ClosureDelayCalc
CombinedField.phrase: Incident Closure Delay|A calculated field based on the number of hours between the event date and the incident report closure date

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes

CombinedField.name: IncidentReport
CombinedField.phrase: Incident Report|A combined field used to describe this incident report when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: Thorslund Discrimination Claim | Active Agenda, HQ | 10-28-2003; Incident ID: 1

SampleItem.name: Both On and Off Company Property
LOW: Possible but unlikely to occur
PROBABLE: Very likely to occur in immediate future
SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00
SERIOUS: Serious injury or illness; 9001.00 to 90,000.00
SEVERE: Death or disabling injury; 90,001.00 to 900,000.00
CATASTROPHIC: Deaths and/or disabling injuries; 900,001.00 to 1,000,000.00
Pending new situation or incident filing
Open - referred to function indicated for review or investigation
Open - review and/or investigation completed and resolution pending

ComboSearchField.name: IncidentReportSituationID
ComboSearchField.phrase: Situation|Filter search results by an associated situation

CodeCheckSearchField.name: RiskImperativeID
CodeCheckSearchField.phrase: Risk Imperatives|Filter search results by one or more related risk imperatives

ViewScreen.name: View
ViewScreen.phrase: View|View summary information about the reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: Form
EditScreen.phrase: Form|Edit summary information about the reported incident or situation

SampleItem.name: Both On and Off Company Property

EditScreen.name: Situations
EditScreen.phrase: Situations|Edit summary information about the situations leading to a reported incident

EditScreen.phrase: Numbers|Associate one or more incident numbers with a reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: Documentation
EditScreen.phrase: Documentation|Track the status of documentation delivery requirements associated with an incident report

EditScreen.name: RiskMatrix
EditScreen.phrase: Risk Matrix|Associate risk matrix values with a reported incident or situation

CATASTROPHIC: Deaths and/or disabling injuries; 900,001.00 to 1,000,000.00

EditScreen.phrase: Products|Associate products and/or services with a situation requiring involvement and/or reporting

EditScreen.phrase: Product|Associate one or more product/service incidents with a reported incident or situation

EditScreen.phrase: Building|Associate one or more building incidents with a reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: EquipmentLoss
EditScreen.phrase: Equipment|Associate one or more equipment incidents with a reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: OtherAssetLoss
EditScreen.phrase: Other|Associate one or more asset incidents with a reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: VehicleLoss
EditScreen.phrase: Vehicle|Associate one or more vehicle incidents with a reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: Contacts
EditScreen.phrase: Contacts|Display contacts associated with a reported incident or situation based upon contact conditions established within the situation contacts module

EditScreen.name: Litigation
EditScreen.phrase: Litigation|Associate law firms and lead attorneys with the reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: Review
EditScreen.phrase: Review|Assign and track incident review activities associated with the reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: RootCause
EditScreen.phrase: Causes|Associate root causes of the reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: PolicyViolations
EditScreen.phrase: Policies|Assign and track policy violations associated with the reported incident or situation

EditScreen.name: ClosureandFollowUp
EditScreen.phrase: Closure|Edit incident closure factors and ongoing follow-up assignments associated with the reported incident or situation

Open - referred to function indicated for review or investigation

EditScreen.phrase: Orders|Associate hazard abatement work orders with the reported incident or situation

EditScreen.phrase: Telephone|Associate telephone calls with the reported incident or situation

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: People Elements
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific information regarding the way this module impacts people should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about how this module impacts, or is impacted by, people in general. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Barriers to success
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific barriers to success in implemeting this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about barriers to success associated with the subject matter of this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Data Collection
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific data collection methods, locations, and resources should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about collecting the types of data associated with the subject matter of this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific data input methods, permissions, and requirements should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about inputting the types of data associated with the subject matter of this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific knowledge and information that impacts the subject matter of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about organizational considerations associated with the subject matter of this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific knowledge of common or past practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about common practices associated with the subject matter of this module and opportunities for change enabled by the Active Agenda project. DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific training considerations and requirements should be entered here. DocumentationSection.title: Applying Knowledge
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific knowledge application methods should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about applying the knowledge collected in association with the subject matter of this module. DocumentationSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific questions that are frequently asked of administrators or implementers should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see the types of questions collected, and answers provided, by the Active Agenda community relating to the subject matter of this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
